title.narrative: Guttmacher Institute 2020 Audit - Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs
New evidence is generated on abortion and related sexual and reproductive health issues and shared with the scientific community.
Number of complete, cleaned data sets

description.narrative: Not all data sets will be made publicly available.

comment.narrative: (2017) Data sets completed for: global unintended pregnancy article; Adding It Up study; India abortion incidence study; Ethiopia adolescent abortion study; Uganda adolescent abortion study; study of gestational age and method of abortion in countries where abortion is legal; Kinshasa abortion incidence study; Zimbabwe abortion incidence study; study of inequalities in need for SRH services worldwide; study of the cost of unsafe abortion to the Senegal health system; comparative study on abortion in South Asia. (2018) Data sets completed for: Sub-Saharan Africa abortion monograph; 2018 Just the Numbers estimates; South Asia comparative abortion study; Adding It Up Pakistan estimates; Adding It Up Nepal estimates; maternal near-miss death in Kenya study; Ghana abortion incidence study; study on health systems’ capacity to provide post-abortion care. (2019) Data sets completed for: Adding It Up 4 report; worldwide abortion and unintended pregnancy estimates; study of cost of unsafe abortion to the Tanzanian health system; unintended pregnancy and experiences of sexual violence in Kinshasa; and Zimbabwe adolescent abortion incidence study.(2020) Data sets completed for: cost of unsafe abortion estimates in Senegal; online provision of misoprostol in Indonesia study; informal use of misoprostol in Colombia study; informal use of misoprostol in Nigeria study; abortion incidence estimates in Ghana; maternal near-miss estimates in Kenya; Kinshasa, DRC adolescent abortion incidence study. (2021) Adding It Up country-level estimates; country-level abortion and unintended pregnancy estimates; abortion-related maternal near-miss estimates in Nigeria and Central African Republic;

title.narrative: Number of data sets uploaded to Guttmacher Data Center

comment.narrative: (2017) Data on need (met and unmet), costs, and benefits from 2017 Adding it Up report and on global unintended pregnancy estimates (2020) estimates from article on unintended pregnancy and abortion by income, region, and the legal status of abortion, data on need (met and unmet), costs, and benefits from 2019 Adding It Up report.

title.narrative: Number of meetings at scholarly meetings and conferences

comment.narrative: (2017) Presented on Ethiopia and Uganda adolescent abortion studies and on Kinshasa abortion incidence study at 2017 International Population Conference; presented on abortion incidence in Zimbabwe, economic and health consequences of abortion in India, medication abortion provision in India, adolescent abortion in Ethiopia, and abortion incidence in Kinshasa at the 2017 Population Association of America annual meeting. (2018) Gave presentations at the 2018 Population Association of America annual meeting on using medication sales data to estimate abortion incidence in India, knowledge and attitudes towards healthcare providers in Zimbabwe, and worldwide unintended pregnancy estimates; gave presentations at the 2018 International Conference on Family Planning on worldwide unintended pregnancy, unmet need for contraception in Nepal, adolescent family planning projections, costs and benefits of family planning in Pakistan, abortion incidence in India, and global unmet need for contraception; gave presentation at the FIGO conference on abortion-related maternal mortality in 10 countries; gave presentation on the Guttmacher-Lancet Commission at the 2018 American Public Health Association annual conference; and gave presentation at the CLACAI conference on preliminary findings from the misoprostol study in Colombia. (2019) Presented on Nepal Adding It Up study at the National Conference on Family Planning in Nepal; gave presentations at the 2019 Population Association of America annual meeting on developing an abortion classification process, incidence of maternal near-miss in Kenya, financial impact of maternal near-miss in Kenya, Bayesian methods for estimating abortion and unintended pregnancy incidence, informal access to misoprostol in Colombia, approaches to estimating abortion incidence in Ghana, trends in method and gestational age of abortion in high income countries, and experiences of obtaining medication abortion in Nigeria; presented on Adding It Up at Women Deliver side event; in-country partners presented on preliminary findings from the misoprostol study at the 1st International Conference on Indonesia Family Planning and Reproductive Health; preliminary findings from misoprostol study in Nigeria were presented at the 8th African Conference on Population in November; and findings from the Tanzania costing study were presented at the 8th African Conference on Population. (2020) Key Adding It Up findings presented as part of the webinar “Universal Health Coverage and SRHR during COVID-19 and beyond” in June 2020; Adding It Up findings were presented as a part of a webinar titled “Adding it Up: Ensuring that Young People Count” on International Youth Day in August 2020 (2021) Quantitative results from study on near-miss and morbidity due to unsafe abortion amongst Africans displaced due to fragility and conflict in CAR was presented at FIGO World Congress in October 2021; presentation on forthcoming scoping review on the impact of COVID-19 on the provision or and demand for SRH services was on December 6, 2021 at the International Population Conference (virtual).

(2017) Published Adding It Up 2017 report in June 2017; Adding It Up methodology report in May 2018; and comparative report on abortion and unintended pregnancy in six Indian states in November 2018. (2019) Published report on Unintended Pregnancy and Abortion in Kinshasa, Democratic Republic of Congo: Challenges and Progress. (2020) Published Adding It Up methodology report in July 2020; published report on abortion and unintended pregnancy in Sub-Saharan Africa

title.narrative: Number of peer-reviewed journal articles published

comment.narrative: (2017) Published article on abortion incidence in Kinshasa, DRC in October 2017. (2018) Published article on postabortion morbidity in Zimbabwe in January 2018; published article on unintended pregnancy worldwide in March 2018; published article on abortion among adolescents in Ethiopia in March 2018; published Guttmacher-Lancet Commission report in May 2018; published article on complications from unsafe abortion in Kinshasa, DRC in September 2018; published article on abortion incidence among adolescents in Uganda in September 2018; published article on abortion incidence in Zimbabwe in October 2018; and published article on multi-country study of health systems’ capacity to provide post abortion care in November 2018. (2019) Published protocol for modeling and reporting unintended pregnancy and abortion estimates; article on novel approaches to estimating abortion incidence; article on trends in abortion methods and gestational age in high income countries; and article on disparities in health service coverage for reproductive health services. (2020) Published an article on abortion incidence and unintended pregnancy among adolescents in Zimbabwe; published Commentary with estimates of the potential impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on sexual and reproductive health in low- and middle-income countries in April 2020; published an article comparing different methods on measuring abortion incidence in Ghana in April 2020; published an article on estimating the incidence of abortion in Ghana in April 2020; published an article on a comparative study on abortion service provision in South Asia in May 2020; published an article on women’s self-reported experiences using misoprostol obtained from drug sellers in Lagos State, Nigeria in May 2020; published article on budgeting for comprehensive sexual and reproductive health and rights under universal health coverage in June 2020; published article on health system cost of postabortion care in Senegal in June 2020; published article on mystery client methodology in Colombia misoprostol study in July 2020; published article on global unintended pregnancy and abortion estimates in July 2020; published article on the incidence of maternal near-miss in Kenya in September 2020; published article on classroom implementation of national sexuality education curricula in four LMICs in September 2020; published article on the prevalence and correlates of perceived infertility in Ghana in September 2020; published article on online abortion drug sales in Indonesia in October 2020; (2021) Published mixed methods study on sexual and reproductive health literacy, misoprostol knowledge and use of medication abortion in Lagos State, Nigeria in May 2021; published article on hormonal contraceptive use in Ghana in May 2021;published article on the use of fertility awareness-based methods for pregnancy prevention among Ghanaian women in June 2021; published article on contraceptive and abortion practices of young Ghanaian women aged 15-24 in July 2021; published article on the health system costs of post abortion care in Tanzania in July 2021; published article on unintended pregnancy, induced abortion and abortion care-seeking experiences among adolescents in Kinshasa, Democratic Republic of Congo in September 2021; presentation on forthcoming scoping review on the impact of COVID-19 on the provision or and demand for SRH services was on December 6, 2021 at the International Population Conference (virtual).

title.narrative: Capacity-building efforts are implemented with partners in each program country to improve skills in conducting SRH research and evidence-based communications.
Number of trainings conducted in project countries

description.narrative: Guttmacher staff conduct trainings to build partners' capacity in various dimensions of research and evidence-based communications.

comment.narrative: (2017) Completed analysis workshop for Zimbabwe abortion incidence study, a study design workshop with partners on misoprostol study, a communications capacity-building workshop with our research and communications partners in Zimbabwe and one with external partners at the International Population Conference in Cape Town, data collection training for fieldworkers in Colombia on the mystery client component of the misoprostol study, and data collection training for fieldworkers in Kenya. (2018) Held a second training for fieldworkers in Kenya; held four data collection trainings for fieldworkers in Ghana; held training for fieldworkers for costing study in Tanzania; held training for fieldworkers in Nigeria for the misoprostol study; held capacity building workshop for advocates in Uganda on communicating research findings effectively; conducted communications workshop in Kampala to build the capacity of advocates to effective utilize scientific evidence; hosted Colombia partners on misoprostol study for a one-week analysis workshop in New York; trained interviewers in data collection instrument for Tanzania costing study; hosted capacity building workshop in Kathmandu for research and communications partners from across Asia. (2019) Conducted a two-day communications workshop on strategic messaging, media outreach and presentation skills for our research and communications partners from Francophone countries in Sub-Saharan Africa; held half-day workshop for civil society partners in Ethiopia on effectively communicating research to policymakers and other stakeholders; hosted Nigeria partners on misoprostol study for one-week analysis and writing workshop in New York; trained staff from Planned Parenthood Association of Zambia on key elements of GLC report and in-country dissemination strategy; trained staff from ABAAD–Resource Center for Gender Equality, based in Beirut, on key elements of GLC report and in-country dissemination strategy in Lebanon. (2021) In March, UMATI and Guttmacher hosted an in-person two-day workshop in Tanzania to train participants on advocacy skills, share the results of the health system costing study, and formulate the recommendations that would be included in the factsheet.

description.narrative: In-country communications partners play a key role in designing and implementing communications strategies, with guidance from Guttmacher communications staff.

comment.narrative: (2017) Developed and began to implement a strategic communications plan with Women’s Action Group, our local partner in Zimbabwe. (2018) Designed and implemented an in-country dissemination strategy for the Ethiopia adolescent abortion article with Ipas Ethiopia; worked with Coalition de Lutte Contre les Grossesses Non Désirées to plan and execute an in-country dissemination event for the Kinshasa study; partnered with Public Health Ambassadors Uganda (PHAU) to carry out dissemination activities in Uganda for the adolescent abortion study. (2019) Partnered with the Kenya Adolescent and Youth Sexual Reproductive & Health Rights (KAYSRHR) in planning and executing dissemination activities for Kenya adolescent Adding It Up report; partnered with Talent Youth Association (TaYA) to plan and organize launch activities for Ethiopia adolescent Adding It Up report; worked with Public Health Ambassadors Uganda (PHAU) on dissemination activities for Uganda adolescent Adding It Up report; worked with CREHPA to plan and implement dissemination activities in Nepal for Adding It Up Nepal report; began planning for in-country dissemination for Kenya near-miss article with APHRC; identified partners and began planning for in-country dissemination of the GLC in Mexico (Balance), Lebanon (ABAAD) and Zambia (Planned Parenthood Association of Zambia); worked with Consejo Nacional de Población and El Colegio de Mexico in executing separate GLC dissemination event held in Mexico City. (2020) Planned for in-country dissemination of our study on misoprostol in Nigeria with AHEAD; partnered with Katswe Sistahood to disseminate findings from our study on adolescent abortion and unintended pregnancy in Zimbabwe; partnered with Brujula Communications to disseminate our study on misoprostol use in Colombia; partnered with consultant Joanna Nerquaye-Tetteh to disseminate materials for our study on abortion incidence in Ghana; partnered with the African Institute for Development Policy (AFIDEP) and began planning for dissemination of our monograph on abortion and unintended pregnancy in Sub-Saharan Africa; partnered with the International Youth Alliance for Family Planning (IYAFP) to disseminate the Adding It Up report; partnered with Ipas Indonesia to disseminate findings from our article on online misoprostol sales in Indonesia. (2021) Partnered with IYAFP to utilize adolescent-focused evidence from AIU country profiles in national advocacy dialogues and social media campaigns in Malawi, Rwanda and Albania; partnered with Chama Cha Uzazi na Malezi Bora Tanzania (UMATI) to the health systems costing study; Our partners at CLACAI translated the Adding It Up country profiles into Spanish for seven countries in the region, including Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Colombia, Ecuador, El Salvador, Peru, which will soon be disseminated and utilized by CSOs as part of their regional advocacy projects; and CLACAI used the AIU regional estimates for Latin America in two published articles. On December 8, the AIU country profile for Nigeria was relied on during Guttmacher’s online Capacity Strengthening workshop for advocates and civil society groups in Nigeria.

description.narrative: Research partners co-author peer-reviewed journal articles and other scientific products, with technical assistance from Guttmacher researchers.

comment.narrative: (2017) Two developing country co-authors on Kinshasa abortion incidence study. (2018) One developing country co-author on Ethiopia adolescent abortion article; two developing country co-authors on Zimbabwe post-abortion morbidity article; two developing country co-authors on the Kinshasa morbidity article; two developing country co-authors on the Uganda adolescent abortion article; four developing country co-authors on Zimbabwe abortion incidence article. (2020) four developing country co-authors on South Asia abortion service provision article; two developing country co-authors on Nigeria misoprostol study; two developing country co-authors on Zimbabwe adolescent abortion incidence study; two developing country co-authors on Ghana abortion incidence and methodology studies; four developing country co-authors on classroom implementation of national sexuality education curricula in four LMICs article; four developing country co-authors on Kenya maternal near-miss study; three developing country co-authors on online sales of misoprostol in Indonesia; 1 developing country co-author on health system cost of post-abortion care in Senegal study (2021) 3 developing country co-authors on prevalence and correlates of perceived infertility in Ghana; 2 developing country co-authors on sexual and reproductive health literacy, misoprostol knowledge and use of medication abortion in Lagos State; 2 developing country co-authors on article on hormonal contraceptive use in Ghana; 2 developing country co-authors on use of fertility awareness-based methods for pregnancy prevention among Ghanaian women; 2 developing country co-authors on article contraceptive and abortion practices of young Ghanaian women aged 15-24; 2 developing country co-authors on article on the health system costs of post abortion care in Tanzania; 3 developing country co-authors on article on unintended pregnancy, induced abortion and abortion care-seeking experiences among adolescents in Kinshasa, Democratic Republic of Congo

title.narrative: Research findings and policy recommendations are translated and strategically disseminated to key stakeholders to encourage evidence-based decision-making.
Number of public education materials published

description.narrative: Includes press releases, fact sheets, and infographics

comment.narrative: (2017) One press release, four fact sheets and eight infographics for Adding It Up 2017; one press release, one fact sheet and one infographic for Kinshasa abortion incidence study. (2018) One press release, four fact sheets and two infographics for worldwide unintended pregnancy study; one press release, one fact sheet and two infographics for Ethiopia adolescent abortion study; one press release, one executive summary and 12 infographics for the Guttmacher-Lancet Commission; one infographic for Just the Numbers; one fact sheet and two infographics for the Kinshasa morbidity article; one infographic on worldwide abortion incidence; and one fact sheet and one infographic for the Uganda adolescent abortion incidence article; one press release, one fact sheet and three infographics on the Zimbabwe abortion incidence and post-abortion care articles; four fact sheets, four infographics and one press release on updated Adding It Up estimates; 13 fact sheets and one press release on abortion incidence in six states in India; three fact sheets and three press releases on Adding It Up for Adolescents estimates in three countries (Kenya, Uganda and Ethiopia); one press release on health systems’ capacity to provide postabortion care; and one fact sheet, one infographic and one press release on Adding It Up estimates for the Ouagadougou Partnership countries. (2019) Three fact sheets and one press release on Adding It Up estimates in three countries (Nepal, Nigeria and Ethiopia). (2020) One fact sheet on abortion incidence and provision of abortion-related services in Ghana; one infographic on the potential impact of COVID-19 on SRH in LMICs; two fact sheets on women and adolescent women in LMICs and twelve infographics were published using data from Adding It Up; one fact sheet and one news release for the study on unintended pregnancy and abortion by income, region, and the legal status of abortion; one fact sheet for Ghana abortion incidence study, one fact sheet for study on health system costs of postabortion care in Senegal, one fact sheet on informal access to and use of misoprostol in Colombia, one fact sheet on women’s experiences with self-managed misoprostol abortions in Lagos State, Nigeria, one fact sheet based on data from the study of misoprostol sales in Indonesia, one fact sheet for Kenya maternal near-miss study, and several fact sheets using Adding It Up data: one fact sheet on abortion in Sub-Saharan Africa, four fact sheets on investing in sexual and reproductive health in Northern, Western, Eastern and Southern Africa, five fact sheets on investing in sexual and reproductive health in Central, Eastern, Southern, Western and Southeast Asia, one fact sheet on investing in the sexual and reproductive health of women in India. (2021)Published fact sheet for Adding it Up: Investing in SRHR and reproductive health in the Caribbean; published fact sheet for Adding It Up: Investing in Sexual and Reproductive Health in South America; published fact sheet for Adding It Up: Investing in Sexual and Reproductive Health in Central America; published fact sheet on online access to misoprostol for self-managed abortion in Indonesia; published fact sheet on informal access to and use of misoprostol in Colombia; published fact sheet on abortion in Sub-Saharan Africa; published fact sheet on investing in safe abortion services in the African Union; published fact sheet on investing in maternal and newborn care in the African Union; published fact sheet on investing in contraception services in the African Union; published fact sheet on investing in treatment for curable STIs in the African Union; published fact sheet on abortion incidence and unintended pregnancy among adolescents in Zimbabwe; published news release to promote the Adding It Up profiles for 130 countries; published fact sheet for Just the Numbers The Impact of U.S. International Family Planning Assistance, 2021; published report for Just the Numbers: Impact of UK Sexual and Reproductive Health Funding for Family Planning, Fiscal Year 2021–2022

title.narrative: Number of commentaries and opinion pieces written by Guttmacher and partners and submitted for publication in newspapers and other media outlets

comment.narrative: (2017) Op-ed on Adding It Up 2017 published in BMJ. (2018) Published op-ed on Guttmacher-Lancet Commission in Mail & Guardian in May; published op-eds on worldwide abortion findings in The Telegraph and BMJ around the time of the Irish abortion referendum; published op-ed on safe abortion access in La Nacion; published op-ed on abortion in Latin America in El Pais; published blog post on GLC recommendations for the Women Deliver Blog; and published op-ed on IMPT Blog focused on multipurpose technologies in celebration of World Contraceptive Day. (2019) Published op-ed on IMPT Blog in September on World Contraception Day. (2020) Published op-ed on the effects of COVID-19 on adolescent SRHR in March; published op-ed on the impact of the Helms amendment in July; published op-ed on the potential negative impact of COVID-19 on reproductive health and rights in July; published op-ed on the negative effects of the Trump administration’s Global Gag Rule order in September. (2021)

title.narrative: Number of briefings on the findings for advocates, policymakers, health care providers, donors and the media

comment.narrative: - February 2017: Met in Copenhagen with foreign affairs staff from the Netherlands, Norway, Finland, Germany, Belgium, the United Kingdom and Denmark to discuss Guttmacher’s ongoing policy response to the actions and statements of the Trump administration. - March 2017: Met with the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs and European NGO delegation representatives to the Commission on Population Development (CPD) to discuss the Commission on the Status of Women and issues related to international family planning assistance; met with the Unit for Development and Human Rights in the UN Funds and Programmes and the Finnish Mission to the United Nations to discuss issues related to international family planning assistance. - April 2017: Participated in a UNFPA strategy meeting to discuss its defunding by the U.S. Government; met with GFF to discuss She Decides and the FP2020 Summit; met with DFID to discuss Guttmacher’s work, FP2020 Summit planning and SheDecides; presented to the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists Global Health Team on current climate around global SRHR. - June 2017: Met with staff of the Swedish Embassy in Washington to discuss Guttmacher’s work; met with the Dutch Mission to the UN to discuss Guttmacher’s work; met with the UK Mission to the UN to discuss UK SRHR policy and potential briefings on Adding It Up; met with the New Zealand Mission to the UN to discuss Guttmacher’s work and New Zealand’s position on SRHR; briefed UK Department for International Development staff on Adding It Up findings. - July 2017: Participated in the Global Health Council’s Health in Post-2015 Roundtable to discuss the High-Level Political Forum (HLPF) and the U.S. government’s relationship with the UN; met with UNESCO to discuss Guttmacher’s comprehensive sex education work; met with SheDecides to discuss policy ideas for the initiative; presented twice at the UN High-Level Political Forum on Sustainable Development on SRHR in the context of the Sustainable Development Goals; briefed Danish parliamentarians on Adding It Up and U.S. foreign policy and its effect in UN negotiating spaces. - August 2017: Met with the World Bank Group to discuss SheDecides and Denmark’s commitment to SRHR. - September 2017: Met with members of European Parliament from Spain and Sweden and DSW staff to discuss Guttmacher’s work and U.S. foreign policy; met with the Permanent Representation of Finland to the EU and DSW to discuss Guttmacher’s work; met with the Portuguese Permanent Representation to the EU to discuss Guttmacher’s work; met with the Permanent Representation of Germany to the EU and DSW to discuss Guttmacher’s work, U.S. foreign policy and potential collaborations; presented at EuroNGOs annual conference on “The Power of Data and Evidence.” - October 2017: Presented preliminary findings from the Zimbabwe study at the Ministry of Health and Child Care to key stakeholders from the Ministry, UN agencies, WHO and Population Services Zimbabwe; briefed the Dutch, Swedish and German governments on recent and forthcoming research findings relevant to these donors’ SRHR programs and discussed implications of evidence for ongoing initiatives and future priorities. - November 2017: Met with the US Mission to the United Nations to discuss UNFPA defunding; met with IPPF to discuss UNFPA strategy with member states in the UN Mission space; met with the South African UN Mission to introduce the Guttmacher Institute and discuss the Guttmacher-Lancet Commission; met with the French Mission to the UN to discuss the Guttmacher-Lancet Commission, UN negotiations next year, and the French government sponsoring events that feature Guttmacher’s work; met with the Gates Institute for Population and Reproductive Health, Johns Hopkins University, to discuss the upcoming International Conference on Family Planning and the Guttmacher-Lancet Commission’s role in it; met with French Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Development to discuss priorities for French aid programming and data collection, potential collaborations, and potential ways that France could support the Guttmacher-Lancet Commission in the EU and World Bank spaces; met with the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) to discuss the forthcoming Guttmacher-Lancet Commission report; presented to visiting Finnish parliamentarian delegation on the US foreign policy on SRH and defunding of UNFPA; briefed the Ministry of Health of DRC and Ipas staff on Kinshasa abortion incidence study findings. - December 2017: Met with the UK Department for International Development to discuss UK policy, the Guttmacher-Lancet Commission and Guttmacher’s forthcoming work. - January 2018: Conference call with representatives from the European Commission, DSW and IPPF to discuss the Guttmacher-Lancet Commission definition of SRHR and developing SRHR indicators; met with staff from the Australian embassy to discuss Guttmacher-Lancet Commission and the Australian aid program; met with Dutch NGO Rutgers to discuss Guttmacher’s work; met on two separate occasions with PAI to discuss several international SRHR topics as well as the Advocacy and Accountability Working Group’s strategy for the Interagency Working Group on RH in Crises; met with the Emergency Response and Recovery Branch of the CDC to discuss SRH in humanitarian spaces; met with International Women’s Health Coalition to discuss strategy and updates related to the Commission on the Status of Women (CSW), Commission on Population and Development (CPD), U.S. Department of State, and the Office of Global Women’s Issues; met by phone with DSW to discuss Guttmacher’s EU strategies; met with the Permanent Mission of Finland to the UN to discuss CSW, CPD and EU strategy; met with the Permanent Mission of the Netherlands to the UN to discuss CSW, CPD and EU strategy and Dutch SRHR strategy; presented to the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists Global Health Team on the current state of global SRHR. - February 2018: Met with IPPF to discuss CSW, CPD and the Guttmacher-Lancet Commission; met with the Permanent Mission of Canada to the UN to discuss CPD, UNFPA, the Guttmacher-Lancet Commission, and Canada’s positioning on SRHR issues; met with World Bank Board of Nordic and Baltic countries to discuss the Guttmacher-Lancet Commission, SheDecides and Guttmacher involvement with Nordic countries in the World Bank space; met with staff from SheDecides and PAI to discuss the Global Gag Rule and provide guidance on SheDecides’ response; met with Global Financing Facility to discuss incorporating the Guttmacher-Lancet Commission report into GFF work; met with PAI and PPFA to discuss messaging strategy in Europe and Sub-Saharan Africa around SRHR and the GGR; conference call with staff from the European Commission, DSW and IPPF to provide briefing on “Just the Numbers” analysis of the impact of US foreign aid; met by phone with DSW to discuss the CSW, CPD, Guttmacher-Lancet Commission events in Germany and European support for the Commission; participated in a webinar to give the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights feedback on SRHR indicators. - March 2018: Participated in a roundtable hosted by the Embassy of Australia to discuss Australia’s approach to women’s economic empowerment; met twice by phone with Action Canada for Sexual Health and Rights to provide briefing on Just the Numbers and discuss the Guttmacher-Lancet Commission and Canadian foreign policy and SRHR aid strategy; met with Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs to discuss the GLC; met by phone separately with Sida, Norad, GIZ and DFID to discuss the Guttmacher-Lancet Commissionmet separately with the Global Financing Facility, She Decides and Girls Not Brides to discuss the Guttmacher-Lancet Commission; met with George Washington University’s Graduate Program in LGBT Health Policy and Practice to discuss the Guttmacher-Lancet Commission and applications for the new evidence for course curricula; met by video conference with Family Planning New South Wales to discuss the Guttmacher-Lancet Commission and points of influence within Australia’s medical and political environments; presented on the Global Gag Rule at a symposium hosted by CHANGE, Care, Center for Reproductive Rights, and Columbia University. - April 2018: Met with Global AIDS Policy Partnership to discuss possible changes to U.S. funding for international SRHR; met with IPPF to discuss strategy related to the CPD; met with USAID to discuss youth work; met with Doctors Without Borders to discuss advocacy and research engagement around the GGR; met with UNFPA to discuss advocacy opportunities; met with the Dutch Permanent Mission to the U.S. to discuss the GLC and CPD; met with New Zealand Family Planning to discuss GLC dissemination in the Asia-Pacific region; met with IPPF-WHR to discuss GLC dissemination in Latin America; met with DSW to discuss CPD strategy and the upcoming International Dialogue on Population and Development; met with GIZ to discuss Germany’s CPD strategy and GLC dissemination; met with the Swedish Delegation to the CPD to discuss EU positions on SRHR issues and the GLC; met with IPPF to discuss strategic direction and collaboration around GLC dissemination. - May 2018: Met with Be-cause Health, a Belgian consortium of health NGOs, to review and discuss the upcoming European Development Days; held launch event in Johannesburg for the Guttmacher-Lancet Commission report; met with a number of African NGOs to discuss the GLC following the Johannesburg launch, including IPPF-African Union, Organization of African First Ladies Against HIV/AIDS, Clinton Health Access Initiative, EngenderHealth Ethiopia, WHO Ethiopia, Family Guidance Association of Ethiopia, and the Consortium of Reproductive Health Associations; met with officer from the African Union to discuss the GLC and bringing evidence to the AU; presented on the GLC at Countdown2030 Europe; held European launch event on the GLC in Geneva during the World Health Assembly. - June 2018: Attended roundtable hosted by the Woodrow Wilson International Center for Scholars and UNFPA to discuss ending preventable maternal mortality; met with UNFPA to discuss upcoming adolescent sexual health event co-hosted by UNFPA and Guttmacher; met with IPPF, DSW, and the European Commission to discuss the GLC and EU commitments to SRHR; met with IPPF to discuss abortion tracking and political changes within the EU; met with PAI to discuss SRHR in universal health coverage; met with the Danish Embassy to discuss upcoming visit by the Danish Minister for Development Cooperation; presented on adolescent access to SRHR and hosted a panel on the GLC during the European Development Days; presented on the GLC to Advance Family Planning Leadership Group; presented on U.S. Global reproductive rights policy at the United Nationals Association of the United States’ Leadership Summit; presented on the GLC for the International Family Planning Coalition; briefed European Parliament members from Italy, Sweden and the UK on U.S. foreign policy and SRHR; presented on the GLC at a retreat hosted by the Canadian government to inform its future SRHR commitments. - July 2018: Met with United Nation Foundation’s Universal Access Project to discuss global financing of global reproductive health; hosted dissemination event for the GLC in Buenos Aires; presented on GLC at pre-conference for the International AIDS Conference in Amsterdam; met with Danish Minister for International Development Cooperation to discuss the GGR, GLC, and SheDecides and the Danish government’s SRHR priorities; met with UN Liaison for OutRight Action International to discuss the GLC and UN engagement. - August 2018: Met with Global AIDS Policy Partnership to discuss possible extension of PEPFAR; met with the Global Agenda Project Coordination for UNFPA to discuss the CPD’s regional reviews and the GLC; met with U.S. Foreign Policy Counsel at the Center for Reproductive Rights to discuss the International Family Planning Coalition. - September 2018: Met with officials from the U.S. Office of Management and Budget to discuss the U.S. president’s 2020 budget and priorities for the International Family Planning Coalition; met with staff for the U.S. Senate Foreign Relations Committee to discuss the reauthorization of PEPFAR; briefed staff from UNFPA Asia Pacific on the GLC; met with Senior Director, Policy and Advocacy for PAI to discuss global program efforts; participated in a panel at the PMNCH annual accountability meeting; met with Director of Global Advocacy for PPFA to discuss the Global AIDS Policy Partnership HIV Prevention Working Group; presented on GLC at the annual meeting of the Asia Pacific Alliance; hosted regional dissemination event in Bangkok for the GLC report; presented on the GLC at the 2018 Human Rights Council session in Geneva. - October 2018: Met with partners in the Universal Access Project to discuss strategies to mobilize support for international family planning in 2019; met with SRH youth advocates to discuss youth engagement and leadership in international family planning; met with UNFPA staff to prepare for GLC dissemination at ICPD; met with Programme Officer, Sida, to discuss GLC; met with First Secretary, Permanent Mission of Finland to the United Nations, to discuss GLC and work with the African Union; met with Counsellor, Permanent Mission of Lebanon to the United Nations, to discuss GLC and CPD; presented on GLC at the African Populations Expert Committee meeting; presented on GLC to the Swedish Sexuality Education Federation; presented on GLC to Sida staff; facilitated a panel on adolescent health at the Wilson Center; presented findings from Zimbabwe abortion incidence study to Ministry of Health officials and Provincial Medical Directors. - November 2018: Participated in roundtable on abortion stigma convened by Marie Stopes International, Advocates for Youth and Ibis; participated in drafting and planning call led by the Center for Reproductive Rights to discuss the Reproductive Rights Are Human Rights Act. - December 2018: met with Senior Advisor on Gender and HIV, Division of Global HIV/AIDS, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, to discuss the President’s Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief; participated in Universal Access Project Partners meeting to discuss 2019 priorities on international family planning issues; met with Global AIDS Policy Partnership group to provide an update on the HIV Prevention Working Group. - January 2019: Participated in panel on humanitarian rights at Columbia University; presented on GLC at the Wilson Center; met with Senior Director of Policy and Advocacy, PAI, to discuss 2019 workplan; met with DSW staff to discuss 2019 workplan; met with Youth Strategy Officer, SRHR Africa Trust, to discuss upcoming work in 2019 and GLC; met with UNFPA staff to discuss development of a global monitoring framework and relevant indicators for ICPD; met with Senior Policy Analyst, Pathfinder International, to discuss 2019 strategy; participated in meeting hosted by PAI and the International Women’s Health Coalition to discuss civil society strategy around universal health coverage; met with Global Consultant Manager, Every Woman Treaty, to discuss incorporating GLC elements into an international treaty on violence against women; met with Programme Officer, Open Society Foundation, to discuss the GLC and universal health coverage; met with staff from World Bank and IPPF to discuss GLC; met with Director of Primary Health Care Initiative, PAI, to discuss the GLC and SRHR in universal health coverage; participated in a meeting of Foreign Policy for America to discuss 2019 priorities. - February 2019: Met with Ethiopia Country Advisor, Packard Foundation to discuss Guttmacher’s work and Ethiopian policy; met with Policy and Advocacy Advisor, DSW, to discuss Guttmacher outreach to German government; met with Counsellor of Development, Embassy of Sweden, to discuss SheDecides anniversary; met with Associate Director, International Planned Parenthood Federation UN Liaison Office, to discuss CPD strategy; met with Zambian Ministry of Health officials to discuss GLC country dissemination; met with UNFPA staff to discuss Zambia GLC dissemination; met with professor and students from University of Zambia to discuss GLC dissemination; met with Associate Director, International Planned Parenthood Federation UN Liaison Office to discuss work in Ethiopia; met with Packard Foundation staff to discuss incorporating GLC into Indian grantee meeting; met with Programme Specialist, UN Women, to discuss Guttmacher’s work and information sharing; presented on GLC at Packard Sub-Saharan Africa Grantees Meeting. - March 2019: Attended meeting on ICPD25 and upcoming Nairobi Summit hosted by UNFPA and the Wilson Center; met with Senior Technical Advisor, Clinton Health Access Initiative, to discuss universal health care and Zambia; co-hosted reception celebrating two year anniversary of SheDecides with coalition partners and the Swedish Embassy; met with International Advocacy Coordinator, International Planned Parenthood Federation (IPPF), to discuss CPD strategy; met with Senior Advisor, World Bank, to discuss foreign policy and UNFPA; met with Advocacy and Communications Specialist, UNFPA, to discuss U.S. government positioning and UNFPA; met with Assistant Director, UN Liaison Office for IPPF, to discuss CSW and CPD positioning and UN Mission strategy; met with directors of Nexus Secretariat to discuss GLC and ICPD25; met with International Advocacy Officer, Danish Family Planning Association, to discuss possible Danish launch of GLC report. - April 2019: Met with U.S. State Department official to discuss CPD negotiations at the UN; met with IPPF staff to discuss Nairobi Summit; met with Advocacy Officer at Medicins du Monde to discuss GLC and US and French foreign policy; met with GIZ staff to discuss CPD negotiations and Nairobi Summit; met with staff from Sida and UNFPA to discuss strategy for the Nairobi Summit; met with Advocacy Officer from Center for Reproductive Rights to discuss Nairobi Summit; met with Advocacy Officer at DSW to discuss engagement with German Parliament and plans for the International Dialogue; met with staff from the Swedish Embassy to discuss SRHR foreign policy; met with staff from Planned Parenthood Association of Zambia to discuss in-country dissemination of the GLC; met with staff from Danish Embassy to discuss GGR; met with SRHR Officer for the city of Gothenburg, Sweden to discuss use of GLC in city council strategic plan; met with International Development Policy Officer at the Australian Embassy to discuss Australian development aid around SRH; and briefed representatives from nine foreign embassies on expansion of the GGR. - May 2019: Met with officers from the Irish Family Planning Association to discuss GLC event in Ireland; met with consultant to discuss GLC event in Portugal; briefed staff from APHRC on ongoing Guttmacher research; met with staff from Planned Parenthood Association of Zambia to continue plans for in-country dissemination of the GLC and met with State Department official to discuss current SRHR issues internationally. - July 2019: Met with Gender-Based Violence Advisor at UNFPA to discuss U.S. funding for UNFPA and the Nairobi Summit; met with staff from African Union to discuss possible opportunities for collaboration with Guttmacher on activities targeting youth SRHR; and gave “Lunch and Learn” presentation on the GLC for DFID staff. - August 2019: Presented on international family planning issues to staff from Sex og Samfund, the Danish Family Planning Association; gave presentation on international family planning work to staff from the Danish Ministry of Foreign Affairs, including the former Danish Ambassador to the UN; met with staff from the Australian Embassy on U.S. foreign policy and human rights; met with staff from the Wilson Center to discuss the GLC and U.S. foreign policy; met with legal advisor from Ipas to discuss promoting the GLC recommendations within U.S. foreign policy; and met with research expert from the Partnership for Maternal, Newborn and Child Health to discuss the Nairobi Summit and UNFPA funding. - September 2019: Met with Health Advisor at DFID to discuss SRHR and the SDGs; met with staff from UNFPA to prepare messaging of AIU data at the Nairobi Summit; met with policy advisor at the Open Society Foundation to discuss GGR; met with staff from the Irish Family Planning Association to discuss GLC report; met with staff from IPPF and Sex og Samfund to discuss UN negotiations and the Nairobi Summit; met with officer from the SRHR Africa Trust to discuss GLC report; met with staff from American Jewish World Service to discuss the Nairobi Summit and forthcoming Guttmacher research; and met with staff from UNFPA to prepare for Nairobi Summit. - October 2019: Convened a meeting of the International Family Planning Coalition’s Legislative Group. - November 2019: Met with Baroness Sugg, UK Minister for International Development, in Nairobi; met with Sigrid Kaag, Dutch Minister for Foreign Trade and Development Cooperation to discuss the Dutch government’s role in global SRHR; met with Alvaro Bermejo (Director General) and Ana Maria Bejar (Director of Advocacy), both of IPPF; at the request of Danish Family Planning Association, briefed the Danish delegation to Nairobi Summit (former Minister for International Development and Cooperation Ulla Tørnæs, as well as 10 Danish parliamentarians) on U.S. foreign policy and positioning; met with Lale Say, Coordinator of the Adolescents and At-risk Populations Team at WHO to discuss future dissemination of the Guttmacher-Lancet Commission; met with Aki Kauppinen, First Secretary of the Finnish Mission to the United Nations to discuss the Nairobi summit and forthcoming Guttmacher research; met with the Planned Parenthood of Zambia team to discuss the in-country GLC project - December 2019: Met by phone with Yoni Ish-Hurwitz, Founder and ED of Human Rights Like-Minded Office, to discuss SRHR, SOGIE and human rights mechanisms within the UN headquarters; met by phone with Ann Nolan, Assistant Professor in Global Health at Trinity College Dublin, to discuss Guttmacher working with Irish parties to establish national abortion research standards; met by phone with Camilla Salvesen, Programme Officer at Norad , to discuss the Guttmacher-Lancet Commission; met by phone with the international Gender Ideology Monitoring Group to discuss 2020 planning and opposition movements focused on gender ideology in Latin America - January 2020: Met by phone with Fassika Alemayhu, Policy and Advocacy Advisor at IPPF Liaison Office to the African Union to discuss Adding It Up dissemination to the African Union; co-hosted (with the government of Denmark and PAI) embassy briefing for representatives from Australia, Iceland, Luxembourg, Belgium, Netherlands, Sweden, Finland, New Zealand, Canada, and the UK to share information; met with David Lawson, Executive Director of Nexus, to discuss Generation Equality Forums and U.S. government positioning; Met with Catarina Cavalho, Preethi Sundaram, and Elisa Malgalhaes, all of the IPPF-UN Liaison Office, to discuss the U.S. government and SRHR planning for 2020; met with the UN Women Statistics and Data team to share Guttmacher’s work; met with Vladimira Kantarova, Population Affairs Officer at the UN Population Division, to share Guttmacher’s work alignment between Guttmacher and UNPD; met with Richard Kollodge, Senior Editor and Communications Advisor at UNFPA, to discuss Adding It Up and ways UNFPA can support this work; met with Nathalia Sanchez, Counselor, Mission of Colombia to the United Nations, to discuss the work of Guttmacher and Colombia’s domestic policies and foreign policy goals and interests related to SRHR. - February 2020: Met with Mikaela Hildebrand, Senior Policy Advisor at Sida to discuss ongoing and future Guttmacher work; met by phone with DSW staffers Cecile Vernant, Head of EU Office, and Steffie Neyens, Advocacy Officer, to discuss EU/EC engagement for Guttmacher in 2020; met by phone with Veloshnee Govender, a scientist at the WHO Department of Sexual and Reproductive Health and Research, to discuss universal health coverage and upcoming opportunities to link Guttmacher work to WHO’s agenda; met by phone staff from the Irish Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade to discuss Irish international aid policy, Guttmacher work and the Generation Equality Forums; met with Ramiz Alakbarov, Director of Policy and Strategy Division and Patricia Da Silva, Consultant Policy and Strategy Division, both of UNFPA, to discuss ways that Guttmacher and UNFPA can work together; met with Upala Devi, Senior Gender-Based Violence Adviser at UNFPA to discuss forthcoming Generation Equality Forums and UNFPA’s work on gender in 2020; met with Rajat Khosla, Human Rights Adviser at WHO, and Catarina Cavalho, Preethi Sundaram, and Elisa Magalhaes of IPPF-Western Hemisphere Region to discuss Generation Equality Forums and U.S. government interference in World Health Assembly plans; met by phone with Maeve Taylor, Director of Advocacy and Communications at the Irish Family Planning Association, to discuss upcoming Countdown 2030 Europe meeting and conversations with the Irish government; met with staff from the Dutch Embassy to plan for the International Women’s Day- SheDecides event (with partners from PPFA, CHANGE and PAI); met by phone with Yeme Belayneh, Country Director-Ethiopia at the Packard Foundation, to discuss opportunities in Ethiopia for the Guttmacher-Lancet Commission in 2020; briefed political section staff at the Swedish Embassy on abortion rights and access in the U.S. - April 2020: Conducted briefing and policy analysis on US foreign policy for Washington, DC- based foreign embassy staff from nine different governments. - May 2020: Presented on the impact of COVID-19 on LMICs on Repros Fight Back podcast. - July 2020: Presented to Australia and New Zealand embassy staff in DC on human rights, State Department and SRHR (with PAI); hosted virtual side event for the High Level Political Forum at the United Nations with over 150 attendees. - August 2020: Presented at a webinar organized by IPPF-South Asia Region titled “Access to Safe Abortion Care in South Asia amid COVID-19: Challenges and Opportunities”; participated in a virtual learning event focused on how to prepare better and advance SRHR in a post-COVID 19 world during which Guttmacher researchers briefed Sida staff in Stockholm and embassies around the world on new Adding It Up estimates; Organized a live streamed event hosted by the Wilson Center titled “Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights Globally: Where We Are And Where We Are Going” which featured new Adding It Up evidence - September 2020: Presented at a webinar titled “Research field notes: Studying women’s access to and self-use of medication abortion” that was held in collaboration with Ipas, Ibis, Marie Stopes International and Population Council; presented in a webinar on the impact of COVID-19 on women in Africa hosted by the Wharton School; briefed the Finnish embassy on the history of SRHR and US foreign policy and SRHR positioning at the UN; briefed DC-based Dutch foreign affairs staff on US foreign policy and SRHR positioning at the UN; presented to the Irish government and Irish Family Planning Association on new data related to Ireland's new abortion law and data collection recommendations. - October 2020: Presented at webinar on global leadership and gender policy titled “Women in Development”; briefed Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs on global SRH; presented global policy programme to Sida staff on global sexual and reproductive health and rights; presented at a webinar hosted by WHO South-East Asia Regional Office on global SRHR; presented at a webinar hosted by IPPF on global SRHR; presented the adolescent-focused Adding It Up Ougadougou Partnership (OP) fact sheet as part of a youth advocacy webinar at the 9th Annual Ouagadougou Partnership Annual Meeting; - January 2021: Presentation to Nordic All-Party Parliamentary Group (Norway, Denmark, Sweden, Finland) - February 2021: Webinar at the International Conference on Family Planning Virtual Forum, entitled “Building Resilience in Adolescent Sexual and Reproductive Health.” - April 2021: Guttmacher staff participated in the Third Global Safe Abortion Dialogue (GSAD) collaborating with colleagues from Ibis in a presentation on current priorities for research on safe abortion, in a session held on April 27. - May 2021: Presented at WHO Virtual Expert Group Meeting on Competency Based Pre-Service Curriculum and Training Resources for Safe Abortion, “Investing in Sexual and Reproductive Healthcare to Prevent Unsafe Abortion in Southeast Asia;” presented on neglected areas of SRHR, drawing heavily on unmet need evidence from AIU, during Canada’s 5th Future Planning Initiative retreat; presented during the SRHR panel session at the "Lives in the Balance: Equity in Covid-19 Response and Recovery" global summit organized by PMNCH and partners; led a session titled “Meeting Sexual and Reproductive Health Needs in Sub-Saharan Africa: A Focus on Preventing Unsafe Abortion,”at the East African Reproductive Health Network (EARHN); presented the AIU country profiles and demonstrated their usability at the UNFPA ESARO advocacy dialogue convened by UNAIDS, UNFPA, UNICEF and WHO in partnership with civil society organizations; presented the Guttmacher-Lancet Commission’s findings and recommendations, as well as relevant Adding It Up evidence during an expert meeting as part of the preparations for the 2021 UN High-Level Political Forum (HLPF). - June 2021: Engaged in discussions with the Nexus Secretariat as they are seeking to undertake a gap analysis of where UN agreed language currently stands across each forum (CPD, CSW, UNGA, HRC, WHA, and more) on different components of the Commission’s comprehensive definition of SRHR; presented the Commission’s recommended interventions at a virtual convening organized by Population Council and PAI that brought together practitioners, researchers and advocates seeking to advance rights-based, quality, and access-driven SRH within UHC financing efforts. - July 2021: Disseminated Adding It Up data during the UN Women #GenerationEquality Forum in Paris - September 2021: Guttmacher co-sponsored a side event at this year’s UNGA focusing on youth SRHR with a panel presentation by our Adding It Up youth partner at Public Health Ambassadors Uganda. - In October 2021, Guttmacher policy staff presented at the American Public Health Association (APHA) conference on “Protecting access to sexual and reproductive health care during COVID-19,” a presentation which made extensive use of the Adding It Up estimates on the importance of investing in RMNH care. - In November, Guttmacher policy staff presented at and facilitated a workshop at the International Dialogue on Population and Development. The workshop was focused on adolescent sexual and reproductive health care and the adolescent-specific Adding It Up estimates served as the primary evidence base. - In November, the High-Level Commission on the Nairobi Summit on ICPD25 Follow-up released its first report, which draws extensively on Adding It Up estimates and the comprehensive definition of the Guttmacher-Lancet Commission. The report published by the independent advisory body aims to track progress on the over 1,300 voluntary commitments made by governments and other stakeholders at the Nairobi Summit that took place in November 2019. - On December 2, Guttmacher participated in the Wilson Center’s Maternal Health Initiative webinar on Preventing Unintended Pregnancies in the Context of COVID-19 . - On December 9, Guttmacher participated in the Government of Canada’s webinar titled A Celebration of Canada’s Achievements in Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights.
